thread.title: REIGN: Ontario shuts out Manitoba
thread.title_full: REIGN: Ontario shuts out Manitoba - Press Enterprise

author: The Press-Enterprise
title: REIGN: Ontario shuts out Manitoba
text:
News Service Reports
Published: Oct. 17, 2015 Updated: Oct. 18, 2015 2:15 a.m. Valentin Zykov recorded his first professional and winning goal with 7.5 seconds remaining in overtime to lead the Ontario Reign, 1-0, over the Manitoba Moose on Saturday night at the MTS Centre in Winnipeg.
Peter Budaj picked up his second shutout in three starts to close the season-opening, three-game trip.
In the three-on-three extra session, the Reign fired seven shots on goal and was given a power play when Joel Armia tripped Jamie McBain on an offensive rush.
Ontario (3-0) finished the game 1-for-4 on the power play while Manitoba (0-2-1-1) failed to capitalize on its four opportunities.
Budaj recorded 20 saves; Connor Hellebuyck made 44 stops.
Ontario will host the Bakersfield Condors in its home opener on Friday at 7 p.m.
